paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the V30M mutation in the TTR gene and its implications in transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTR).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among these identified mutations, V30M is the most common type of ATTRv.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation leads to reduced stability of TTR tetramers, contributing to amyloid aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: The V30M variant is common in certain populations, particularly in Northern Europe.
variants.additional_notes: The paper emphasizes the role of the V30M mutation in ATTR pathology.
key_quotes: V30M is the most common type of ATTRv.
The evident effect of TTR mutations is the reduced stability of TTR tetramers.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the V30M variant in TTR.
